title: Notorious criminal Loku Patty’s associate remanded
byline: A businessman who is accused of handling financial operations of a notorious criminal known as ‘Loku Patty’ has been remanded until October 24, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: New ‘Korean Language Examination Center’ opened
byline: A new electronic examination center equipped with modern facilities, including smart devices such as tablets, was officially opened today (22) to facilitate Korean language proficiency tests required for employment in South Korea.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas within Colombo District
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that a 10-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas within the Colombo District tomorrow (23).

title: Kehelbaddara Padme’s illegally acquired assets worth Rs. 50M seized
byline: Illegally acquired assets valued at around Rs. 50 million, allegedly belonging to the notorious underworld figure Padmasiri Perera also known as ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, have been seized by the Police Illegal Assets Investigation Division.

title: Sri Lanka to sign UN Convention against Cybercrimes
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a proposal to sign the United Nations Convention against Cybercrimes (UNCC).

title: Gold falls again as rally comes to halt, stock markets mixed
byline: Gold and silver sank for a second day on Wednesday (Oct 22), bringing a rally in the precious metals to a juddering halt, while stocks were mixed after United States President Donald Trump remarked that a meeting with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping might not take place.

title: Officials instructed to collect data of individuals unable to repay microfinance loans
byline: The Sub-Committee appointed by the Ministerial Consultative Committee on Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment has instructed officials to take steps to collect data on individuals who are unable to repay microfinance loans...

title: SpaceX says it has cut Starlink services to Myanmar scam camps
byline: Elon Musk’s SpaceX says it has cut Starlink satellite communication links to more than 2,500 devices used by scam compounds in Myanmar.

title: Underworld behind Weligama PS Chairman’s assassination?
byline: The assassination of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara earlier today (22) has once again sparked public discourse about underworld criminal activities.

title: CCD submits report to court on Ishara Sewwandi
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division today submitted a report to the Colombo Magistrate’s Court regarding the ongoing investigations into Ishara Sewwandi, who has been identified as a key suspect in the murder of underworld gang leader Ganemulla Sanjeewa.

title: Weligama PS chairman injured in shooting
byline: The Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara, has reportedly been injured and hospitalised following a shooting incident, a short while ago.

title: Netflix announces new Kennedy family series starring Michael Fassbender
byline: One of America’s most famous families is getting the Netflix treatment.

title: Putin-Trump summit on hold after Russia rejects ceasefire
byline: A planned summit between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin was put on hold on Tuesday, as Moscow’s rejection of an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine cast a cloud over attempts at negotiations.

title: At least 63 die in Uganda highway crash as two buses collide head-on
byline: A road accident involving two buses on one of Uganda’s busiest highways killed at least 63 people and left others injured, police said on Wednesday.

title: Corruption case against ex-Minister Wimal Weerawansa fixed for hearing
byline: The case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, over the alleged illegal acquisition of assets and funds worth nearly Rs. 75 million during his tenure as a Cabinet Minister, has been fixed for hearing by the Colombo High Court.

title: One dead, 10 injured after bus crashes into tree on Mannar-Medawachchiya road
byline: One person has died and 10 others have been injured and hospitalized in a tragic bus accident that occurred between 35Km Post and 36Km Post on the Mannar-Medawachchiya main road this morning (22).

title: Cabinet approval to hold ‘Sri Lankan Day’ from Dec. 12-14
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved holding the “Sri Lankan Day” from December 12 to 14, 2025 at the Colombo Town Hall grounds, Vihara Maha Devi Park, and adjoining roads.

title: Indian capital Delhi air quality remains in very poor category
byline: Air quality in the Indian capital on Wednesday continued to remain in a very poor category, the Central Pollution Control Board said.

title: CID records statement from model Piumi Hansamali regarding ongoing probe
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has recorded a statement from popular model and actress Piumi Hansamali, for approximately two hours.

title: Peru declares 30-day state of emergency in Lima to tackle rising crime
byline: Peru’s President Jose Jeri declared on Tuesday a 30-day state of emergency in the capital Lima and the neighboring province of Callao, saying the move was to battle rising crime.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka drop by Rs. 20,000 today
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has declined by around Rs. 60,000 in comparison to last Friday (17), while today (22) alone, the price of gold has decreased by around Rs. 20,000.

title: Four dead, 9,500 affected in 12 districts due to adverse weather
byline: At least four individuals have died in recent days owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the country.

title: Supreme Court annuls medal awarded by Peradeniya University
byline: The decision taken by the administration of the University of Peradeniya to present the “Professor E.O.E. Pereira” gold medal, awarded to the best student of the Faculty of Engineering in 2015...

title: Stolen Louvre jewellery worth €88m, prosecutor says
byline: Jewellery stolen from the Louvre in Paris in a daring daylight robbery has been valued at 88 million euros (£76m; $102m), a French public prosecutor has said, citing the museum’s curator.

title: CAA issues gazette announcing maximum retail prices for imported rice
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has issued a gazette notification announcing the maximum retail prices (MRP) for imported rice varieties, effective from October 21, 2025.

title: Train services on up-country line continue to be disrupted
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced that train services on the up-country line will continue to be restricted today (22).

title: Pakistan Navy seizes record amount of narcotics worth nearly $1bn in Arabian Sea
byline: The Pakistan Navy seized a record amount of narcotics worth more than $972 million in the Arabian Sea, the US Combined Maritime Forces (CMF) said.

title: Kelani Valley Line to be extended to Ratnapura?
byline: The government has decided to conduct a feasibility study and prepare a detailed plan to extend the Kelani Valley Line up to Ratnapura.

title: Govt to provide schoolchildren and Piriven students with vouchers to purchase shoes
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to provide vouchers to purchase a pair of shoes to selected schoolchildren, Piriven students and Seela Mathas for the year 2026.

title: Parliament turns pink in support of breast cancer awareness
byline: Members of Parliament and staff today (22) attended Parliament session dressed in pink or pink shaded attire to support the breast cancer awareness initiative.

title: CCTV footage of gunmen involved in Weligama PS chairman’s murder
byline: CCTV camera footage showing the gunmen involved in the shooting of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera entering his office and fleeing the premises has been received by Ada Derana.

title: Kandy-Colombo train services to resume after several days
byline: Several train journeys along the main line, which were temporarily suspended due to a train derailment and adverse weather conditions, will resume operations starting tomorrow (23), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: Ayurvedic spa owners file petition seeking legalization of treatment centers
byline: The Sri Lanka Spa Owners’ Association has filed a writ petition with the Court of Appeal seeking an order directing the Attorney General to take immediate steps to prepare a bill to legalize and regulate Ayurvedic massage treatment centers.

title: Heavy rains, strong winds expected in various parts of the island today
byline: The low-pressure area located near the northern coast of Sri Lanka is expected to intensify further and move west-northwestward and is likely to develop into a Depression over the coastal areas of northern Tamil Nadu and south Andhra Pradesh during this evening (22), the Meteorology Department said.

title: Weligama PS chairman dies after being shot inside his office
byline: The Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara, also known as ‘Midigama Lasa,’ who was critically injured in a shooting incident this morning, has succumbed to his injuries while being admitted to the hospital, a short while ago.

title: Israel’s parliament gives initial nod to occupied West Bank annexation
byline: A bill applying Israeli law to the occupied West Bank, a move tantamount to annexation of land which Palestinians want for a state, won preliminary approval from Israel’s parliament on Wednesday.

title: Five train journeys including Colombo-Badulla night mail cancelled
byline: Five train journeys, including the two night mail trains scheduled to run today from Colombo Fort to Badulla and from Badulla to Colombo Fort, have been cancelled, Sri Lanka Railways said.

title: Ukrainian city in total blackout after ‘massive’ Russian assault
byline: The Ukrainian city of Chernihiv is in total blackout following what the authorities describe as a “massive” assault by Russian missiles and drones, with hundreds of thousands of people affected.

title: Four police teams assigned to probe murder of Weligama PS Chairman
byline: Four police teams have been assigned to investigate the murder of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara, police stated.

title: Over 100,000 tourists arrive in October
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first 20 days of October stood at 103,491, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI releases browser in attempt to rival Google
byline: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has unveiled an artificial intelligence-powered web browser to challenge competitors like Google, which operates Chrome, the most popular browser in the world.

title: Landslide warnings issued for residents of 11 districts extended
byline: Early landslide warnings issued to residents of multiple areas in 11 districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island, have been extended.

title: Piyal Manamperi remanded till October 29
byline: Former SLPP Angunukolapelessa Pradeshiya Sabha member Piyal Manamperi who was arrested in connection with the recent recovery of chemicals allegedly used to manufacture ‘Ice’ in Middeniya has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas of Colombo today
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that a 10-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas within the Colombo District today (23).

title: Man dies after being hit by train in Wellawatte
byline: An individual has died after being hit by a train traveling from Panadura to Puttalam, near the Wellawatte Railway Station, last evening (22).

title: Heavy showers above 75mm expected in several areas today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: U.S. sanctions Russia’s top 2 oil producers to press for ceasefire in Ukraine
byline: US Treasury Department on Wednesday announced sanctions on Russia’s two largest oil producers, Rosneft and Lukoil, in a bid to pressure Moscow to agree to an immediate ceasefire in Ukraine.

title: Fallen tree in Katugoda disrupts rail services along Coastal Line
byline: Train operations along the coastal line have been disrupted due to a fallen tree between Katugoda and Galle, the Department of Railways stated.

title: Rail services between Kandy and Colombo resume after disruption due to bad weather
byline: Rail services between Kandy and Colombo that were disrupted since Sunday (19) owing to landslides and a train derailment have resumed this morning (23).

title: UN’s top court says Israel obliged to allow UN aid into Gaza
byline: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) has said Israel has a legal obligation to facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip by the UN and its entities to ensure the basic needs of Palestinian civilians there are met.

title: Probe underway through CCTV footage to identify assassins of Weligama PS Chairman
byline: Investigations have been launched through CCTV footage regarding yesterday’s murder of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, Lasantha Wickramasekara, police stated. more..

title: Louvre Museum Director admits security failures, proposes new measures
byline: Louvre Museum Director Laurence des Cars on Wednesday admitted failures in the museum’s external surveillance system and announced a series of new security measures.

title: Apple may be forced to allow rival app stores in UK
byline: Apple may have to allow rivals to operate their own app stores on iPhones in the UK, after a ruling from the competition regulator.

title: Special directive issued to magistrates by Judicial Service Commission
byline: All magistrates have been instructed by the Judicial Service Commission to take necessary steps to remove drug samples weighing less than one kilogram that have accumulated at the Government Analyst’s Department.

title: One in every four people over the age of 25 may experience stroke - health experts
byline: One in every four people over the age of 25 may experience a stroke during their lifetime, health authorities say.

title: Two killed in separate road accidents in Bandaragama and Polonnaruwa
byline: A 17-year-old school student was killed in a fatal road accident in Bandaragama last evening (22).

title: MPs, staff to be subjected to special inspection ahead Budget speech
byline: A special security inspection will be conducted at the Parliament complex over three days in November ahead of the 2026 Budget speech, the Speaker of House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne informed Parliament today (23).

title: 20 new self-check-in kiosks installed at BIA
byline: Another 20 self-service check-in kiosks have been installed at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) to improve efficiency and passenger experience at the airport.

title: Strong winds in New Zealand leave thousands without power, more than 100 flights cancelled
byline: Strong winds of up to 155km/h (96mph) in New Zealand has left around 90,000 homes without power and forced authorities to cancel more than 100 flights, report local media.

title: Wife of ‘Backhoe Saman’ further remanded
byline: The wife of underworld figure ‘Backhoe Saman’, Shadhika Lakshani, who is currently in remand custody under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, has been further remanded until October 31 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Common curriculum proposed for all preschools from 2026
byline: A common single curriculum framework will be implemented across all preschools island-wide from 2026, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has announced.

title: 3,000 families in 14 districts affected by adverse weather across Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 12,142 individuals from 3,036 families have been affected by the adverse weather conditions prevailing in the country, according to the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Alibaba launches AI chatbot service in renewed consumer push
byline: Alibaba launched a new AI chatbot assistant service on Thursday, refreshing its push into a consumer-facing space that is dominated by ByteDance and Tencent.

title: Over 650 acres of government-held land in North and East released to previous owners
byline: Around 672 acres of land controlled by the military in the North and East for several years have been released to its previous owners, Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd.) stated.

title: India PM Modi to attend ASEAN summit virtually, ruling out Trump meeting
byline: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate virtually in the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, ruling out a possible meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump and indicating New Delhi and Washington may not be close to sealing a trade deal.

title: Oil rises 3% as India reconsiders Russian oil amid fresh US sanctions
byline: Oil prices jumped more than 3% on Thursday, extending gains from the previous session, as India buyers started reviewing their Russian oil purchases after the U.S. imposed sanctions on major suppliers Rosneft and Lukoil over the Ukraine war.

title: King Charles commences historic state visit to the Vatican
byline: King Charles and Queen Camilla have arrived in Rome at the start of a historic state visit to the Vatican, where they will meet Pope Leo in a symbolic display of unity between the Church of England and the Catholic Church.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka drop by Rs. 10,000 today
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has declined by around Rs. 77,000 in comparison to last week , while today (23) alone, the price of gold has decreased by around Rs. 10,000.

title: Weligama PS Chairman’s Murder: Suspects to be arrested within the next two to three days - Minister
byline: Individuals involved in the assassination of the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Lasantha Wickramasekara are expected to be arrested within the next two to three days, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated.

title: Over 800 persons on death row in Sri Lanka: Prison Spokesman
byline: A total of 826 individuals are on death row at present, Commissioner of Prisons and Media Spokesman Jagath Weerasinghe stated.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: An ‘Amber’ weather advisory has been issued for strong winds and rough seas by the Department of Meteorology.

title: Common curriculum proposed for all preschools from 2027
byline: A common single curriculum framework will be implemented across all preschools island-wide from 2027, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has announced.

title: White House East Wing will be torn down fully to make way for Trump ballroom
byline: The full East Wing of the White House will be torn down to make way for President Donald Trump’s new ballroom, contradicting the former New York real estate magnate’s pledge that the project would not interfere with the existing U.S. landmark.

title: Sri Lanka’s export earnings surge to nearly USD 13B in first 9 months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector has demonstrated resilience and steady growth during the first nine months of 2025, recording total earnings of US$ 12,986.52 million, the Export Development Board (EDB) stated.

title: Private company manager posing as Bribery Commission officer arrested
byline: A Manager of a private company in Polonnaruwa has been arrested for allegedly impersonating an officer attached to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Bill Gates to make Indian TV debut on ‘Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2’
byline: Earlier today, reports circulated online stating that Smriti Irani’s Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 is set to achieve another milestone. Businessman and philanthropist Bill Gates is scheduled to appear in the ongoing limited series via video call, with his storyline spanning three episodes.

title: Undertaking not to take ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ out of CID extended
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered today (23) the extension of the undertaking given not to take ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, who is in the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department, out of the CID until December 02.

title: High-level meeting held to strengthen security measures at BIA
byline: A high-level meeting was held at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake today (23) jointly chaired by the Deputy Minister of Ports and Aviation, Janith Ruwan Kodituwakku, and the Defence Secretary, Air Vice Marshal (Retd) Sampath Thuyacontha.

title: National awards ceremony for excellence in agricultural research held under President’s patronage
byline: The National Awards Ceremony for Excellence in Agricultural Research for the years 2023 and 2025 was held this afternoon (23) at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH), Colombo, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Mexico flood death toll rises to 78 as recovery efforts continue
byline: The death toll from devastating floods that struck Mexico earlier this month has increased to 78, with rescue teams continuing search operations for missing individuals. The severe weather affected five states, displacing thousands and causing extensive infrastructure damage across multiple regions.

title: Sri Lanka’s Lahiru Achintha wins gold at Asian Youth Games 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s Lahiru Achintha delivered an outstanding performance at the Asian Youth Games 2025 in Bahrain, securing the gold medal in the Boys’ 1500m event on Thursday.

title: King Charles and Pope Leo pray together in a 500-year first
byline: Britain’s King Charles and Pope Leo prayed together in the Vatican’s Sistine Chapel on Thursday, in the first joint worship including an English monarch and a Catholic pontiff since King Henry VIII broke away from Rome in 1534.
